revised_title: The Nature of Niter and the Nitro-aerial Spirit
tldr: The author discusses the composition and properties of niter (saltpeter) and the nitro-aerial spirit, which he believes to be responsible for various natural phenomena such as fire, fermentation, and the expansion of air. He explains how these elements are produced in the earth and how they interact with other substances, including sulfur and other acid liquors. The author also explores the role of the nitro-aerial spirit in animal and vegetable life, as well as his views on the nature of the sun and cold.
